definitions.definition: Space for something, or to carry out an activity.
Sufficient space for or to do something.
A space between the timbers of a ship's frame.
A separate part of a building, enclosed by walls, a floor and a ceiling.
(in the plural) A set of rooms inhabited by someone; one's lodgings.
(always in the singular, metonymy) The people in a room.
definitions.example: The room was on its feet.

definitions.definition: An area for working in a coal mine.
A portion of a cave that is wider than a passage.

definitions.example: Some users may not be able to access the AOL room.

definitions.definition: Place or position in society; office; rank; post, sometimes when vacated by its former occupant.
Furniture sufficient to furnish a room.
To reside, especially as a boarder or tenant.
definitions.example: Doctor Watson roomed with Sherlock Holmes at Baker Street.

definitions.definition: To assign to a room; to allocate a room to.
